article_node.title: The iPhone 17 Pro could cost an extra $200 this year
article_node.summary: Apple is expected to raise the iPhone 17 Pro starting price to $1,199, a $200 increase over the previous model, driven by a shift to 256GB storage and higher RAM. TrendForce predicts the Pro Max will also see a $100 hike to $1,299. The price bump aligns with broader cost pressures and tariff impacts, while the standard iPhone 17 is likely to stay at $799-$849. Apple’s event is slated for September 9, 2025, with pre‑orders beginning September 12 and sales on September 19.
